question.title: How to set SNIMatcher when using Spring Boot, correctly?
question.body:
I'm using Spring Boot 3.3.4 with Tomcat and came across this code inside ServerNameExtension.java:

            // Does the server match the server name request?
        SNIServerName sni = null;
        if (!shc.sslConfig.sniMatchers.isEmpty()) {
            sni = chooseSni(shc.sslConfig.sniMatchers, spec.serverNames);
            if (sni != null) {
                if (SSLLogger.isOn && SSLLogger.isOn("ssl,handshake")) {
                    SSLLogger.fine(
                            "server name indication (" +
                            sni + ") is accepted");
                }
            } else {
                // We do not reject client without SNI extension currently.
                throw shc.conContext.fatal(Alert.UNRECOGNIZED_NAME,
                        "Unrecognized server name indication");
            }

This would reflect the behaviour I'd like to have, exactly. However, it relies on having sniMatchers set, which is done by using SSLParameters. Unfortunatelly, I don't find any possible place to do so. I've tried using TomcatServletWebServerFactory, but SSLParameters got ignored.

This was my most promising approach, but it won't work like documented in the code:

@Bean
public WebServerFactoryCustomizer<TomcatServletWebServerFactory> sslContextCustomizer(final SslServerConfiguration sslServerConfiguration) {
    return factory -> factory.addContextCustomizers(context -> {
        for (var connector : Container.getService(context.getParent()).findConnectors()) {
            for (SSLHostConfig hostConfig : connector.findSslHostConfigs()) {
                for (SSLHostConfigCertificate certificate : hostConfig.getCertificates()) {
                    // could be set here, but .getSupportedSSLParameters() is always null
                    // and setting it with new SSLParameters is getting ignored:
                    //certificate.getSslContext().getSupportedSSLParameters().setSNIMatchers();
                }
            }
        };
    });
}

I would appreciate any hint how to set SNIMatchers.
